content: top edge of the bag to round 7 of the body weave in your ends visor switch to your light blue yarn round 1 chain 8 starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet 1 into the next 7 stitches rotate your work and single_crochet 1 into the next 7 stitches on the other side of the chain slip_stitch to the first single_crochet in the round and chain 1 14 round 2 scinc into the same stitch as the slip_stitch single_crochet 2 scinc x2 scinc single_crochet 2 x2 scinc into the last stitch switch to your black yarn and do a color change in the last stitch of the scinc color changing tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=f8vtkk-_3do slip_stitch into the first single_crochet of the round and chain 1 20 continuing with your black yarn round 3 single_crochet 20 around slip_stitch into the first stitch of the round and fasten_off leaving a long tail to sew the visor onto the main body 20 sew the face shield onto the main body between rounds 6 and 11 using the blo be sure to stuff it lightly after you ve sewn it about halfway on switch to your white yarn cut a small piece of white yarn and use it to embroider the reflective accent onto the visor you have finished your crewmate……or are you truly the imposter thank you for choosing my pattern this pattern and photos were written and taken by whitewolfsstudio/whitewolfstreasures/ashlee jackson this pattern is for personal use only the pattern or parts of it may not be reproduced distributed or resold translated published altered shared or posted for sale or free over the internet or offline you can sell items made from this pattern provided they are handmade by yourself in a limited number and you give credit to the designer
